abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is rated
            satisfactory. While the adjustment component of the project
            is likely to be sustainable, the investment component
            sustainability remains unclear, mainly, due to the lack of
            statistical information supporting the impact of credit
            lines in the private sector, and its potentiality. Both the
            Bank, and the Borrower's performances gave mixed
            results, for although overall, both were rated, as
            satisfactory, the Bank supervision is rated as deficient,
            given an irregular supervision, and, the Borrower's
            compliance with loan covenants, is rated deficient, due to
            its non-completion of the technical assistance program, and
            continued auditing deficiencies. The key lessons spell out
            the effectiveness of successive projects in building
            sectoral reforms, since, the continuation of the credit
            lines financed by the Bank, contributed to meet the shortage
            needs of long-term investment resources. However,
            cancellation of investment loans took place, due to the high
            cost of Bank funds in relation to decreasing Moroccan
            interest rates. Unfortunately, the lending instrument at the
            time - Sector Adjustment Lending, based on the Bank's
            own cost of funds, with a tendency to lag in a falling rate
            environment - hindered success. Had the new LIBOR-based
            products been available, such funds might have remained competitive.
